title: Auth0 in Angular: [Part1] Authenticate your Angular app
desc:
This is part 1 of the 'Auth0 in Angular' beginners series. In this series we will learn how to secure an Angular application using Auth0. This article covers the user authentication with Auth0.

You won't become an Auth0 pro after reading this series, but you'll have a good foundation that will help you start using Auth0 in your everyday Angular development.

title: Adding the notification component to an Angular application
desc: Application example built with Angular 13 and adding the notification component using the ngx-toastr library.

title: UTC to local time convert in Angular - Angular pipe
desc:
Working with dates could be tricky. If you show date to the user that is located in the same time zone you do not have a problem at all. But if the time zone is different you will show a date that the user will not understand.

Instead of using the local time, we can use UTC (Coordinated Universal Time). But still, UTC is not user-friendly. The best solution is to show the user UTC time but convert it to his time zone. In this case, the user will always understand the time.

We're gonna create a UTC converter pipe that will work with ISO-8601 format.

title: Google Authentication in Angular with OAuth & angularx-social-login
desc:
It enables apps to obtain limited access (scopes) to a user's data without giving away a user's password. It decouples authentication from authorization and supports multiple use cases addressing different device capabilities.

OAuth is a standard that apps can use to provide client applications with 'secure delegated access'. OAuth works over HTTPS and authorizes devices, APIs, servers, and applications with access tokens rather than credentials.

title: ConnectTech2021 - Mike Hartington Deep Dive into Angular Builders
Setting Page Titles Natively With The Angular Router
desc: When building applications with Angular, one common thing you should do is have the page title update after each successful navigation. This helps with accessibility and improves the navigation experience. This is something you've had to do manually in the past, but a recent feature added to the Angular Router coming in version 14 handles this natively, while allowing you to customize its behavior. This post shows you how to use the Angular Router's new built-in feature to for setting the page title after each successful navigation.

title: Provide and conquer — Injected Angular forms
desc: UX often dictates that complex forms should be broken down to steps, which are spread in multiple pages, and each one is typically validated separately. Sometimes it is also sent to the server for intermediate storage before the final submission. Using Angular, a common approach is to create one form per page, within the container component. The form is validated on submit, before moving to the next step. The form data is either stored in a service, populating the final model, and/or sent to the server. This approach works fine, however it is limited. Navigating between steps might cause inconsistencies as a change in a previous step might have impact on the final model data.

title: ConnectTech2021 - Sergio Brito How to Organize an Angular Project
ConnectTech2021 - Patricio Vargas Performant and Accessible Angular Apps as PWAs
Single Component Angular Modules and Component Tests go hand in hand
desc: Writing a good test is not as simple as it sounds, it takes some guidance and practice to get it right. One of the key factors that make a good test stand out is the arrange (or setup) part. For Angular component tests, Single Component Angular Modules (SCAMs) help to make the difference between an OK test and a good test. With SCAMs, you end up with no fragile test setups with half of the code, which results in a happy and productive, team that isn't afraid to move things around.
